intro: Taeniophyllum montanum, commonly known as the mountain hairroot, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Andes mountains. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. It produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
